summary: Tom Bombadil is a character created by J.R.R. Tolkien, who first appeared in a 1934 poem. He is known for his appearance in Tolkien's famous novel, "The Lord of the Rings," where he meets the main characters in the Old Forest. Bombadil is described as a spirit of nature, similar to a demigod, and is said to be the spirit of a place. He has been left out of some adaptations of "The Lord of the Rings" due to his non-essential role in the main story.
title: Tom Bombadil
